titleStmt.title:
A Character Panegyrick, & Description of
the Legion Clubb.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: As I strole the City, oft I
See a Building large & lofty
Not a bow-shot from the College
Half the Globe from Sense & knowlege.
By the prudent Architect
Plac'd against the Church direct
Making good my Grandames jest
Near the Church──── you know the rest.
Tell us what the Pile contains
Many a Head that holds no Brains
These Dæmoniacks let me dubb
With the Name of Legion Clubb
Such Assemblies you might swear
Meet when Butchers beat a Bear
Such a Noise and such Haranguing
When a Brother Thief's a hanging
Such a Rout & such a Rabble
Run to hear Iack-Pudding gabble
Such a Crowd their Ordure throws
On a far less Villains Nose.
Could I from the building top
Hear the ratling Thunder drop
While the Devil upon the Roof
(if the Devil be thunder proof
Shou'd with Poker fiery red
Crack the Stones & melt the lead
Drive them down on every Skull
While the Den of Thieves is full
Quite destroy that Harpyes Nest
How might then our Isle be blest
For Divines allow that God
Sometimes makes the Devil his Rod
And the Gospel will inform us
He can punish Sins enormous
Yet shḍ S\wif·over·────\t endow the Schools
For his Lunaticks & Fools
With a Rood or two of Land
I allow the Pile may stand
You perhaps will ask me, Why so?
But it is with this Proviso
Since the House is like to last
Let a Royal Grant be past
That the Clubb have right to dwell
Each within his proper Cell
With a passage left to creep in
And a Hole above for peeping
Let them when they once get in
Sell the Nation for a Pin
While they sit a picking Straws
Let them rave of making Laws
While they never hold their tongue
Let them dabble in their Dung
Let them form a Grand Commee\tilde·above·word\
How to plague and starve the City
Let them stare and Storm & frown
When they see a Clergy gown
Let them e'er they cra\c·over·s\k a Louse
Call for th'Orders of the House
Let them with their Goslin Quills
Scribble senseless Heads of Bills
We may while they strain their Throats
Wipe our A────s with their Votes
Let Sṛ Tom that rampant Ass
Stuff his gutts wth. Flax & Grass
But before the Priest he fleeces
Tear the Bible all to pieces
At the Parsons Tom Holloo boy
Worthy offspring of a Shoe boy
Footman Traytor vile Seducer
Perjur'd Rebel vile Accuser
Lay thy paultry Privilege aside
Spring from Papist and a Regicide
Fall a working like a Mole
Raise the dirt abṭ yṛ hole
Come assist me Muse obedient
Let us try some new Expedient
Shift the Scene for half an hour
Time and place are in thy power
Thither gentle Muse conduct me
I shall ask, & you instruct me
See the Muse unbars the Gate
Hark the Monkeys how they prate
All the Gods who rule the Soul
Styx thr'o Hell where waters roll
Let me be allowd to tell
What I heard in yonder Cell
Near the Door an Entrance gapes
Crou'ded round wtḥ antick Shapes
Poverty and grief and Care
Causeless Ioy and true despair
Discord periwigg'd wtḥ Snakes
See the dreadful Stride she takes
By this odious Crew besett
I began to rage & frett
And resolvd to break their Pates
E'er we enter'd at the Gates
Had not Clio in the nick
Whisper'd me, let down yṛ Stick
What said I, is this the mad House
These she answer'd are but Shadows,
Fantoms bodyless & Vain
Empty Visions of the brain.
\del·Into·the·add·In the\ porch Briareus stands
Shews a Bribe in all his hands
Briareus the Secretary
But we Mortals call him Cary
When the Rogues their Country fleece
They may hope for pence apiece
Clio who had been so wise
To put on a Fools disguise
To bespeak some Approbation
And be thought a near Relation
When she saw two hundred Brutes
All involv'd in wild disputes
Roaring 'till their Lungs were spent
Privilege of Parliamṭ
Now a new Misfortune feels
Dreading to be lay'd by th'Heels
Never durst a Muse before
Enter that infernal Door
Clio stifled wth. the Smell
Into Spleen & Vapours fell
By the Stygian Streams that flew
From the dire infectious Crew
Not the Stench of Lake Avernus
Cou'd half so much offend her Nose
Had she flown but o'er the Top
She must have \felt·over·fel'd\ her Pinions drop
And by Exhalations dire
Tho a Goddess must expire
In a Fright she crept away
Bravely I resolv'd to Stay
When I saw the Keeper frown
Tipping Him with half a Crown
Now said I we are alone
Name yṛ Heroe's one by one
Who is that Hell featur'd brawler?
Isn't Satan? no 'tis Waller
In what figure can a Bard dress
Iack the Grandson of Sṛ Hardress
Honest Keeper drive him further
In his looks are Hell & murder
See his scowling Visage drop
Iust as when he murder'd Throp.
Keeper shew me where to fix
On the puppy pair of Dicks
By their lanthern Iaws & leathern
You might swear they both were Brethren
Dick Fitz-baker Dick the Player
Old Acquaintance are you there
Dear Companions hugg and kiss
Toast old glorious in yṛ piss
Tie them keeper in a Tether
let them starve & stink together
both are apt to be unruly
Lash them daily lash them duly
Tho 'tis hopeless to reclaim them
Scorpion Rods perhaps may tame them
Keeper yon old Doater smoak
Sweetly snoring in his Cloak
Who is He? I'ts Humdrumm Wyn
Half incompass'd \del·wth\by his Kin
There observe the tribe of Bingham
For He never fails to bring them
And that base Apostate Vesey
With Bpps\tittle\ Scrapps 'tho fat & Greasy.
While He sleeps the whole debate
They submissive round him wait
Yet wḍ gladly see the Hunks
In his Grave & search his Trunks
See they gently twitch his Coat
Iust to Yawn & give his Vote
Always firm in his Vocation
For the Court agṭ the Nation
Those are Allens Iack & Bobb
First in every wicked Iobb
Son & Broṛ to a queer
Brain sick brute they call a Peer
We must give them better Quarter
For their Ancestor trod Mortar
Who at Howth to boast his Fame
On a Chimney cut his Name
There sit Clemts- Dilks & Carter
Who to Hell wḍ dye a Martyr
Such a Triplet coud you tell
Where to find on this side Hell
Gallows Carter Dilks & Clemtṣ
Sowse them in their own Excremtṣ
om.
om.
Every mischief in their Hearts
If they fail tis want of Parts.
Bless us Morgan art thou there man
bless mine Eyes art thou the Chairman,
Chairman to yon damnd Committee?
Yet I look on thee wth── pity,
Dreadful Sight! What learned Morgṇ
Metamorphosd to a Gorgon!
For thy horrid looks I own
Half convert me to a Stone
Hast thou been so long at School
Now to turn a Factions Tool
Alma Mater was thy Mother,
\del·And·Ev'ry·add·Every\ young Divine thy Brothr.
Thou a disobṭ Varlet
Treatst thy Mother like an Harlot──
Thou ungrateful to thy Teachers,
Who are all grown rev.d Preachers;
Morgan, wḍ it not surprise one,
Turns his Nourishṭ to Poison──
When you walk among yṛ Books
They reproach yụ with their looks
Bind them fast or from their Shelves
They'l come down to right themselves──
Homer, Plutarch, Virgil, Flaccus
All in arms Prepare to back us,
Soon repent or put to Slaughter
Ev'ry Greek & Roman Authṛ
Will you in yṛ Factions Phrase
Send the Clergy all to graze──
And to make yṛ Project pass
Leave them not a Blade of Grass?
How I want thee hum'rous Hogart
Thou I hear a pleasant rogue art
Were but you & I acquainted
Ev'ry Monster shou'd be painted
You shḍ try yṛ graving Tools
On this odious groop of Fools
Draw the Beasts as I describe them
From their Features while I gibe them
Draw them like, for I assure yẹ
You will want no Charactura
Draw them so that we may trace
All their soul in every Face.
Keeper I must now retire
You have done wṭ I desire
But I feel my Spirits spent
With the Noise, the Sight, the Scent.
Pray be patient yụ shall find
half the best are still behind
You have hardly seen a Score
I can shew two hundred more
Keeper I have seen enough
Taking then a pinch of Snuff
I concluded looking round them
May their God, The Devil confound thm
Except the righteous fifty two
To \del·whom·add·whom\ immortal Honour's due.
om.
om.
